Reviews.Title: “Smaller than the other MVCI resorts but equally lovely.”
Reviews.Author: mindelicious
Reviews.Content: As an MVCI member, I've stayed at quite a few of their resorts. This one is beautiful. The views of the Doral Resort golf course are absolutely stunning and every villas offers them. They have activities like every other MVCI resorts, some for adults, some for kids and some for everyone. We took the resort-organized trip to the everglades and it was awesome. They provided transportation from the resort and we went to an Indian village, air boating and to some great BBQ. The resort offers a pool, BBQ grills, bocce, shuffleboard, cornhole, on-site fishing and a complimentary shuttle to the Doral Golf & Country Club across the street. The country club is currently managed by Marriott but it being bought out by Trump hotels in June 2012 so I don't know if MVCI guests will still have complimentary access to it after. The only thing different about this resort is that the villas are somewhat small compared to other MVCI resorts I've stayed at. The villa still offers all the same amenities, but on a much smaller scale. But I would still definitely stay here again. The staff is amazing and incredibly friendly. The grounds immaculate and the rooms are very modern and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: PVinAZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about a year ago by accident and loved it, wanted to return during the WGC Cadillac Championship (aka the Doral Open). Got lucky with timeshare trade and was here through Friday of the golf tournament. Great rooms, convenient to the Doral, shopping, restaurants etc. Hope we can book next year during the golf tournament.

Reviews.Title: “A quick, but fun stay”
Reviews.Author: Amandatrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night and were able to get a good price (maybe because it was last minute?). The staff was very friendly, and the room quiet, large and nicely appointed. The second bedroom had only one bed, but the pull-out couch was very comfortable and easy to use. The pool is just OK, but the free shuttle and pools at the hotel/spa across the street are fantastic. We would stay again just to spend time in the large heated pool, waterfalls and pool slide. We saw the activity sheets and I imagine if we were there for a week we would probably try a few of them -- at least the water aerobics and a craft of two.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent golf holiday”
Reviews.Author: Golfingbird1
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare in Spain for a week at the villas at Doral. We got plenty of space, newly refurbished apartment with a view over one of the five golf courses at the famous Doral resort. Very kind and efficient staff, and great service during the stay. You can call a free shuttle anytime to take you to and from the golf club. There are fast heating gas barbecues at your disposal at ground level. Loads of restaurants within a few minutes drive, and near the attractions of Miami. We found absolutely nothing to be unhappy about except the extremely noisy fridge! Highly recommended for golfers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 1 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: marianne13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night in early February after we stayed in Key West for 5 nights. We drove to Key West from MIA so upon returning we decided to stay in Miami for 1 night so that we had enough time to catch our flight home. This hotel was great for what we needed. It was close to the airport and our room was very clean. All the villas have 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. That was way more space than what we needed (not complaining). This hotel would be perfect for families. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was that the bed was a little hard. Other than that we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Gasser1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of February. The units are lovely, modern furniture and very well equipped as is the case for all Marriott timeshares. The units overlook a lake with a fountain in the middle which is a lovely with a golf course in the background. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. It is just opposite the Marriott Doral hotel and you can use the facilities there. If you don't want to walk the 5 minutes it takes, they will happily drive you there at the drop of a hat. Doral is a quiet residential area with a lot of big businesses but close enough to get into Miami. The car journey takes 15-20 minutes when the traffic is good. We were with my children in their 20's who partied in Miami at night. A taxi back costs 40 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are here for”
Reviews.Author: daisy47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week as a family. Check in was easy but the crib we requested and confirmed was not in the room and it was late at night. The room itself is very nice. Great kitchen, dining room, three flat screen tv's, two bathrooms, a shower that could fit 8 people, a large soaking tub in the master, a nice balcony and comfortable beds. It is a updated, spacious apartment. The cleaning was not up to usual hotel standards. They call it a "tidying service" meaning they change the towels, sometimes the sheets, empty the garbage and wipe down but no toilet or shower or floor cleaning. Can get messy with a young child in the room. I know the rooms are larger but I imagine many of the vacation timeshare owners don't even use the housekeeping service everyday. The room was still clean except there were definitely scattered small hairs in the bathroom when we arrived and some mold in the shower. The sound between the rooms is good. I rarely every heard the neighbors talking except through the vents in the bathroom. The planes fly RIGHT next to the hotel (on both sides) but it isn't too bad and they were usually done by bedtime. The grounds are nice. There is a walking path, nice bbq's to use, a large hot tub and a large pool. Unfortunately the pool is cold and only gets sun in the morning. Once noon hits, it is too cold to swim and we are swimming fanatics. The chairs around the pool also don't get much sun in the afternoon so the few people that wanted the fresh air were huddled around the pool fully dressed. If you want GREAT pools, go across the street to Doral Golf and Spa Resort (where you have privileges and a shuttle to take you to and fro). The pools are beautiful, plentiful and one is as hot as bath water. It was great. They also have a waterslide but it was broken while we were there. When it is 90 degrees out, the pool temperature is probably not a problem but high season is winter. The pool should be heated as much as Doral's. There are lots of activities planned daily but many of them require reservations or cost money. Seemed like very few people did the activities. Some were great and some were a real rip off. $15 for them to give you plain, white t-shirts and some squirty dye for YOU to make tie dye t-shirts? Seriously? And you needed a reservation for that ahead of time. The activities could use some work. No free breakfast here. The distance to Miami Beach/Downtown and Ft Lauderdale is a haul to do everyday. At least 30 mins to Miami Downtown and 45 to Ft Lauderdale. If you are staying for business in the (industrial) area or golfing at the Doral and need a large room, it is a great option. If you are going to be in Miami Beach everyday, stay somewhere closer. There is a lot of stuff around the hotel such as grocery stores, restaurants and shopping. All in all, the room was nice but I wouldn't pay $325 a night again to stay here (we didn't but that was the house rate). The space in the room doesn't make up for the other small annoyances at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great week in Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: roamer007
Reviews.Content: Good apartments,all overlooking a lake. Accross the road is a Marriott golf hotel. You can use the golf and other amenities there and a shuttle bus will take you if you dont want to walk.The hotel has several restaurants and live music in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great fo golf”
Reviews.Author: BillyBigTime
Reviews.Content: Was playing golf at Doral and the villas were a superb place to stay. Very spacious apartments with great amenities. Lovely pool area with views to the Great White course. Transfer to/from the golf club very smooth with helpful drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis In Middle of Miami”
Reviews.Author: westsidebernie
Reviews.Content: I have to say this was very nice. Villa with two rooms was great. Nicely put together. Two miles from Fla Turnpike. Approximately 12 miles to South Beach. You get to use all of Doral Spa & Resort next door (very short walk). Staff was very nice... Eladio and Housekeepers very helpful. Thank you. If you eat next door at Mesazul - get the crab cakes to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: merijanoo
Reviews.Content: Great resort in a very nice location. The rooms are very very nice. Rooms are very spacious and updated. All the conveniences away from home, 3 tvs with dvd players, nice bathrooms and showers.Had room 5606 over looking the lake. Marriott vacation club did a very nice job with this property. David at the front desk was very helpful, all the staff were very nice. This resort is close to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: AncientMariner924
Reviews.Content: Lots of space in a two bedroom, two bathroom suite with a full kitchen and a balcony. Attached to the Doral golf couse, which has advantages for the golf fans. Wish it was closer to the beach or other attractions, but it's not a major issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Fussycathy
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the ordinary exterior of this place. I was blown away with the luxurious 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit! It was so clean that it felt like no one anyone had even stayed in the place before. The furniture, wall colors, pictures, and appliances were great. Our large balcony had a view of a lake. We only booked a one-night stay and didn't want to leave. Great beds, linens, and showers. And, the unit had a washer and dryer which we used. We didn't use the pool, but it looked great and people were in it in the evening when we checked in. The people behind the front desk were helpful and welcoming. It was actually fun checking in. If we ever get back to the area, we will definitely stay there. We didn't take advantage of it, but booking at the Villas gives you access to all the restaurants across the street at the famous Doral resort with golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Rochis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriot's Villas at Doral on November 2011. The apartment we got was huge, very clean and comfortable. It had 2 bedrooms, 2 sofa beds, 3 flat screens, DVD player, full kitchen. It also had a very beautiful view to the golf course. Marriot Villas offer you activities for all family members, which is nice! The location is not outstanding. There are no stores nearby, but t the place is very nice and well worth the money. The only thing I could only complain about is that I called the service desk to ask for a cab and they forgot to call it!!!! (I had to take an international flight back to my home country!)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean rooms with comfortable furniture and beds”
Reviews.Author: travelinkelly
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Doral Marriott villas. The lodges are on a fantastic golf course with spectacular scenery. Our room was always clean and comfortable. We were participating in the nearby Pritikin Health and Longevity center which was just a short walk down a beautifully landscaped, well lit path. We didn't have any room service or eat in connected restaurants. The pool was fantastic and the spa available to guests is first eare

Reviews.Title: “Recently remodeled”
Reviews.Author: 859Kathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days after a cruise. The villa we were in was recently remodeled and the decor was beautiful. In the master bedroom there was a large bath and a shower. The kitchen is fully equipped and there was a washer/dryer. The area is close to Dolphin mall and easy to find. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive but what an experience!”
Reviews.Author: Fik101
Reviews.Content: All I can say about Doral is wow! What a property and was here on business. Wished I had the time to enjoy the pool, spa, and amazing golf course but did not have the luxury to do so. Old charm property, great views, and top notch service. The main bar/lounge was great! Great bartenders, and the Curischo Steak was perfect! I was here for business but next time I am coming for pleasure! --

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MizzRita
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-bedroom unit in Building 5 that was recently renovated, overlooking the lake and Greg Norman's Great White golf course at Doral. Free shuttle to the Marriott Doral Hotel for golf and restaurants. Villa guests get reduced golf rates. The location is within easy driving distance to all Miami attractions and a 10-minute drive to the Dolphin Mall, a large outlet shopping center. Once again, Marriott tops all timeshare competitors.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sweet 16 Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicole E
Reviews.Content: For my daughters 16th birthday we stayed at this awsome hotel from September 22 to the 26th. Everyone at this hotel is very very friendly and have great customer service. The grounds are beautiful as well as the rooms that are extremely spacious and clean. They were beautiful, the beds were very comfty and the bathrooms were nice as well. We had the two bedroom villa that was in the main building and recently undated. The pool was very nice as well as the jacuzzi and it was in genreal a very relaxing stay. We would definatly stay again. (Renting a car is the best when staying at this hotel to get to the beachs). ENJOY! P.S: This hotel is more so like a Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: Pros - Spacious and will comfortably accomodate a family (2 bed/2 bath) - Well equipped with washing and cooking appliances, quiet airconditionning - Renovated in 2011 so units are in good condition - Good location for golfing - Close to Dolphin Mall - Fitness room open 24/7 - Access to facilities of the Marriott Doral accross the street - Great value (paid $101/night) Cons - Unattractive location, count 30-40 minutes to reach South Beach or Key Biscayne - Occasional noise from airplanes landing at MIA - Bad housekeeping service (did not give priority to guests at the elevator, came at any time of the day (once as late as 4pm) - Front desk not always helpful and could not get late checkout (as marriott gold we normally get this with no fuss and the property was far from full) Bottom line Go for it if you need the space and amenities of a condo, and if priced much lower than beachside equivalents.

Reviews.Title: “Just check in and relax!”
Reviews.Author: coastwanderer
Reviews.Content: Not far to Miami airport, this resort has it all. If you're a golfer you'll be in paradise. If you want a spa, that's there too. The 2 bedroom where we stayed was on the top floor with a balcony overlooking one of the golf courses. Unit was very well appointed and comfortable, 3tvs and a huge master bathroom. The large, well equipped fitness room is open 24 hours and there are walking paths along a lake as well as over to the Doral Golf Resort. Day trips and lots of activities at the resort are offered. You do need to drive to get to Miami (about 12 exciting miles) but if you want to stay in, there are several restaurants at the Doral resort across the street. It's a great place to vacation, and we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, not 100% impressed with this resort - Location leaves much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Niquolle330
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doral Resort (aka Mariott's Villas at Doral) on a business trip with my company in January 2011. The rooms were all laid out differently; some had multiple closets and some had multiple sink areas, all had a different layout due to the set up of the buildings. Our room looked out (what was called the "patio" as opposed to a "balcony" on the higher floors) into a huge painting of Tiger Woods. Not the best view in the house. Overall, the rooms were fine, but not up to par with the pricing of the resort. The one thing that I do have to say about staying at the Doral was the drive it takes to get to South Beach or downtown Miami. It was about a $30-$40 cab ride, not including tip, on a major highway/freeway to get to any of the Miami attractions, and this was a major downfall of the resort. Perhaps if I were a golf enthusiast, this resort would have received higher reviews, but for someone here on a business trip, the trek to any of Miami's attractions encourages low remarks from my perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: bouncerhome
Reviews.Content: We recently had to stay at Mariott's Villas at Doral on a stopover. We own Marioot timeshare and I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised with the accomommodation. The apartments had been recently refurbished to a high standard and were very clean. The view from the balcony looked over a lake. The swimming pool area was excellent and there were amentieis at the marriott hotel across the road and in walking distance. The staff were helpful and friendly and I would recommend this accommodation to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kww355
Reviews.Content: The Villas at Doral were adequate. We didn't find them quite as nice as the Marriott Villas at Newport Coast, California. The employees were quite friendly and helpful. Just a tip: the address may be NW 87th Avenue, but you'll need to turn on 41st Street to get in the gates.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, not enough amenities!!”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTraveler11
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this resort are beautiful and laid out perfectly. All of the staff were awesome and extremely helpful. The only fault that I could find was that they should really have a little bar area where you can get something to drink and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value during the off-season and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JannyBaby
Reviews.Content: We were there to see a Rutgers football game but also brought our golf clubs to play Doral. Pleasantly surprised by the condition and cleanliness of the "condo." After playing golf in the wet-heat, we preferred to eat in and relax. A Publix was nearby to provide ready to cook choices. We got a great deal compared to South Beach or coastline properties and the atmosphere was relaxed. The Villas personnel transported us to "the real" Doral willingly and efficiently. For those that are not used to Florida, expect mid-day thunderstorms. There's a reason tee-times are easy to come by at that time. Also, Doral staff were really great. Doral food -- not so much. Highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property”
Reviews.Author: StevenVA
Reviews.Content: I wish this property was closer to the beach, but it is a beautiful place with super nice rooms. Not alot to do right around the area, so you pretty much need a car. Nice pool, nice golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel - Right on the Money”
Reviews.Author: Pajaro
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Villas are great to stay with family or friends. They have two beautiful bedrooms, two bathrooms and additional big sofa bed in living room. The kitchen is complete, and also has washer/dryer. Check for web or weekend offers at hotel website. Great pool, gym and golf course. For the price of one hotel room for two, this villa sleeps six comfortably. The price is less than a Miami hotel room. The location is convenient, close to airport and with easy access to mayor highways. Dolphin and Miami International Malls very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: latkwat13
Reviews.Content: This was one of several trips for my family to the Miami area. The Villas at Doral was a nice option. We had a 2-bedroom unit overlooking the pool. There was a king bed in the master suite, and with a queen bed with pull-out sofa in the second bedroom. The living room also had a pull-out sofa. The full kitchen amenities were perfect for preparing meals, and the washer and dryer in the room was a great addition. We drove a short distance away to the Costco for groceries. There is access to the amenities at the Doral Golf Resort and Spa across the street, and a complimentary shuttle to take you back and forth. There is no charge, but we tipped our driver each time. On multiple occasions, during our week-long stay, we had the same driver by the name of George, who was very courteous. The Villas at Doral has a golf course, but we did not use the facilities. The gym was adequate for quick workouts. I did a morning walk that the Villas schedules for guests and staff. It was nice getting to know the staff and their experiences in the area as well. There were activities at the pool, but for younger children. My teenage children enjoyed pool volleyball, the fitness center, and other activities at the Doral Golf Resort and Spa across the street. So, we used the shuttle a lot. The fitness center even had a trainer who provided assistance with your workout. Access to those amenities made the stay even better. There were fitness classes available also. When it was time to wind down and relax, Marriott's Villas at Doral was the perfect place to spend quality family time. The beds were comfortable and I enjoyed the view of the lighted fountain on the property, from the bedroom window every evening. It was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a destination in itself but close to great stuff and rooms are great!”
Reviews.Author: swiftee
Reviews.Content: The Villas were brightly colored and quite ugly from the outside but the rooms were ritz carlton quality: nice decor, large living room, kitchen and good sized bedrooms with a TV in each room. YAY! The grounds at the villas were nothing to rave about but we drove to the everglades for birdwatching and ate at some local restaurants: some good, some not. The staff was helpful and friendly. Every night the hotel and funny little mixers: one was a free wine and cheese party. The gym was small but adequate and appreciated. The kids seemed to love the pool and there were covered couches set all around the pool. The Villas at Doral are across the street from another fancier marriott property and we had full use of the grounds next door. You can walk there or take a free 30 second shuttle. The marriott next door seems to cater to convention groups and is kind of retro-swanky but overpriced in the bar and restaurants. They do have live music in the ritzy bar. The pool next door has a water fall and slide. I guess the Doral golf course that runs through both properties is well known. We had a view of the royal palms on the course from the balcony and did some bird watching there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Belle2o3
Reviews.Content: This was the only resort available through II exchange. It was my 25th birthday and I wanted to celebrate. But I also wanted to just relax... Although the resort is far from all the attractions we did rent a car and so traveling wasn't bad. We had the two bedroom villa. The masterbedroom was big the bed was comfy the shower fit both of us and the tub well the tub was perfect. The kitchen was nice. We pretty much made breakfast everyday and sat out in the balcony enjoying the lake view (even the late lightning storms). Everything was provided. Soap/sponges coffee pot utensils etc. We used the washer and dryer. Detergent was also provided. For the 1st few nights the pool was open and at night was warm and relaxing. However, after the 3rd day they closed it down fir renovations so we had to go across the street to the golf resort. They provided a shuttle. The pools in that side are very nice. Great water slide (I was a kid again) and it was pretty empty. Overall it was nice. The activities were also fun to be a part of. We got to meet some interesting characters. When we wanted to party we headed out to south beach and stayed there the whole day/night. Staff was friendly. We didn't really have to deal with them since honestly we figure things out on our own. They did help with the car rental and did recommend a few spots. We didn't have any problems. It was relaxing it was clean it was perfect. Best of all my boyfriend proposed to me at azul restaurant so Miami will always have a special spot in my heart.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!!”
Reviews.Author: BankerLisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just two nights pre-cruise at this property and really enjoyed our time there. The rooms are large and clean - two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full kitchen, dining area, and living room. The master bedroom had a very comfy king sized bed plus a large soaking tub and giant shower. Second bedroom had a queen sized bed with a sofa bed. Our unit over looked the lake, and was just one building down from the pool and hot tub area. We spent a very nice afernoon and early evening hanging out by the pool, mixing daquaries in our room (blenders are in each room), and just having fun with our friends. This is a great place to go if you are with a group of friends. There is ample dining room, and the pool is uncrowded. We were told that we had access to the pools and facilities next door at the Doral Golf Resort (also a Marriott property) but did not feel compelled to do so. The only drawback to this property is it is a decent drive to any tourist facilities, other than golf. South Beach, without traffic, was about a 25-30 minute drive away. With traffic it was even longer. But even with that distance, we will definitely be looking to return to this property. We'll be sure to have another rental car and some nerves of steel for the Miami traffic.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT FOR THIEVES!”
Reviews.Author: ABThatsMe
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a vacation in Miami, the place is gorgeous, clean rooms, nice pool area, the scenery of the pond and the golf course is lovely. My one complaint is that you need to be on the look out for thieves. My sister's camera (which held over 800 pictures) was STOLEN from her car. Overall, good stay, but keep your prized possessions with you at all time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: crazyrai
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed at the Villas 2 days pre-cruise, we had 6 girls on our party and we had plenty of places to sleep. Had a very nice pool that was mostly empty with lots of chairs, they will also transport you to the golf hotel which has a nice walk in pool, which i didnt take pictures of, but would reccomend checking it out and its on nice property. The villas had 2 pullout couches, 1 queen bed and 1 king bed, full kitchen and nice patio. The day we arrived the hotel supervisor arranged for us to get a ride to the market, which was in a strip mall with resturants, booze mart ect, he said this was a 1 time service and it was much appreciated by us as we needed food for 6 to last 2 days... We did need to take a cab the next day for a few forgotten items, and it was 8 each way.. We also arranged transport to the port of MIA, which was 8pp.. Nice would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms ' high service”
Reviews.Author: Raquelita_BCN
Reviews.Content: fantastic rooms, very comfortable. the service is good. it is close to the aiprot but not to the city. not always free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: maryanne19
Reviews.Content: Good location. Near to airport,shopping malls, grocery store and restaurants.Very well appointed apartment- very clean and spacious. Three flat screen TV's available which were a steal for the four of us for a week. All appliances and kitchen utensils were in good condition. There was a problem with the clothes dryer but this was fixed within 30 minutes of our complaint. Although we stayed on the fifth floor the noise from the airport did not bother us. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but next to loud elevator”
Reviews.Author: CruisinThruLife
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very professional, the room was beautiful but we were placed next to an elevator that was very loud! The building we were in was an older charming building, beautifully renovated, but the elevator was obnoxiously loud and slow. I would definitely stay here again, with the request to be placed away from the elevators. We had a nice balcony, and with all of the greenery around, it was a wonderful place to sit in the evening to relax. We stayed here before going on our cruise - also rented a car from the airport and was able to drop off here and then take taxi to the ship which was so much more convenient than returning the car to the airport or even the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice getaway - no problems at all”
Reviews.Author: ronlord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a 2 bedroom villa as a pre-cruise getaway. The grounds are impeccable, the pool is clean, hot tub is hot and the room was really nice. We had plenty of room for 6 people. Balcony was large and breezy, which us where we ended up spending most of our time. They had a free hot dog/hamburg lunch poolside when we arrived, which was nice. Shopping is close by, as is the highway. I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rory2123
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I traveled with two friends and since there are two bedrooms and a pull out in the living room in every unit everyone had their own sleeping space. The master bedroom's bathroom is huge. There is a large soaking tub actually in the master bedroom which may sound odd but it works. The beds, for my taste, are too soft but I prefer a hard bed. Ample amount of pillows, and a patio that overlooks the resort's pond and golf course. The price is just out-of-this-world amazing. We stayed for 5 days and paid a total of about $750 -- an average of $150 per night for a two-bedroom condo. The people who work there are extremely pleasant and though we ran into some cleaning staff members who did not speak Engligh it wasn't too difficult to get our requests across. The only knock is the location. There are some resturants but no attractions in the area. However, if you like Cuban coffee there is a gas station near by that makes the best. Also, local Cuban nationals hang out and eat there, making me think that their coffee and wide array of food is at least semi authentic. Parking is not a problem, you just need a pass. There parking area is secured with a security booth that was manned every time we came in or left. The hotel is also close to Miami's airport and though it is on the landing route with the patio door closed you do not hear the planes. Any time I go to Miami, I am staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “loved it ,get me more airline ticketsto visit again”
Reviews.Author: banzaitnt
Reviews.Content: First use of my vacation exchange, stayed in the main bldg 4 2nd floor,quiet rooms quiet area, helicopter landed in the lot just outside the room one morning and it sounded like a vacum cleaner, didnt realize it was a helicopter at first.(heli was a one off occurence) all amenities you need, especially if you are new to the country and don't know your way around. Pre arrival survey was sent,you can have groceries in your room before you rrive. great list of property activities,shuttle next door to the doral golf resort.Close to the shopping areas and close enough to the sites like seaquarium,zoo,jungle island etc. A former reviewer complained about exorbitant prices in the on site convenience store...NOT TRUE many items were marginally more expensive than what I saw in the supermarkets, the convenience store is great for personal care products, snacks, ice cream, microwaveable meals, bread,milk, breakfast items, wine etc. Most Staff were extremely helpful and enthusiastic especially the ladies, the guys would be helpful but pale in comparison to the ladies and in some cases you get the feeling they just cant help because they just don't know much. I saw the concierge once for the week i was there but that one time he was very helpful but he was never at hisdesk and phoning was a waste. Rooms had been recently renovated, not bad but the contractors owe somebody change. Certain areas were also textured walls that were very dusty and had black stuff either mold or dust, hence my downgrade on cleanliness, we found baby food and hair clips from previous guests and it was obvious the sofa bed wasnt moved for cleaning nor were the pots scrubbed well. Don't get me wrong, great facilities, all the tableware and cookware you need including, corkscrew, tongs knives,spatulas, baking trays etc. microwave, toaster,blender, range, dishwasher detergent, dish soap, enough coffee tea and laundry detergent to get you started, comfortable beds, three large flat screen lcd tvs, dvd player in livingroom.....tvs are brand new and kinks still present so they go on and off at oddtimes and sometimes program guide and stations change colour for no reason....ghosts in the machine?? Comfortable beds, tub to fit you and some friends.Warm salt water vs chlorine pool, very hot spa/jacuzzi near pool. Great place for families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort away from the city”
Reviews.Author: mderaba
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The resort is well-maintained and secure. The views from the upper floor villas are fantastic! They overlook the lake and fountain and the Doral Golf Course. The units are spacious with all the amenities needed. There were many activities throughout the week for all ages. We didn't take advantage of many, but we did enjoy the Fourth of July barbecue by the pool. The service was great, especially at the front desk at check in. We arrived early, and even though we expressed a desire via an e-mail survey sent out by the Concierge prior to our visit for Building 7 and a high floor unit, that one wasn't quite ready yet. However, the front desk clerk was very accommodating in offering a similar unit in Building 5, which was a perfect place for us, as it's near the pool but not right overlooking the pool and lobby/arrival area. Some previous posts mentioned outdated or older furnishings, but we didn't experience that. The clerk explained that Building 4 has been remodeled, and the other buildings are newer. In any case, I appreciated the fact that we got an e-mail asking for our preferences on not just the building and unit, but also for any activities they could help with during our stay. This is the first time I remember getting a pre-arrival survey. In my opinion, after many exchanges to many areas and different resorts, Marriott always offers a higher quality stay and service. We had a rental car during the week and found it necessary to get to the Miami beaches, the Keys (nice trip for two days!), and restaurants and shopping. There are several large malls nearby. It was nice to be away from the city traffic in a quiet area. However, there are many planes that fly right over the resort due to the nearby Miami Airport. This did not bother us at all. My only complaint, and it's a minor one, was that the thermostats in the units were set to a minimum temperature that was just not cool enough for me at night for comfortable sleeping. I slept anyway because there are overhead paddle fans in each bedroom. It was a very hot, humid week, not atypical at this time of year, so again, this is just a minor issue. All in all, our family of four had a great time here. My teenage son also really liked the fitness center, as it was larger and better equipped than most resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Golf and Spa...riffic facility made for the perfect get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: bizzbriefbrad
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great weekend get-a-way i recommend the "Golf Weekend Package" at Doral and include a special 80 minute massage because we should all know what it feels like to be in heaven. First, being a golfer I have always wanted to play the "Blue Monster" reknowned for the challenging holes and deep rough. and the "White Shark" Greg Normans design for it's rtight fairways. My wife and I played the White Shark on Saturday and were treated to a very nice round. Good holes, good length, challenging par 3's and not a lot of trouble on the sides. It kept a good pace of play. Saturday afternoon we hit the Spa. Historically we are not "SPA" people, but I have become a convert. The faciity was beautiful. Marriott has put a lot of money into the building and the quality level was A+++++. SInce I am a SPA neophyte the routine was foreigh to me, but I caught on quickly. I recommend getting to your massage at least 45 minutes to an hour early. I hit the whirlpool first, got all warmed up and then jumped into the 40 degree cold icy plunge. Yikes! Got my attention but also was invigorating. I then went into the "Steam Bath, the dry heat Sauna and then they had an amazing Kohler shower with 7 sprayer heads coming from the top and 2 sides. Wiuth the sound of classical music playing a happily stood there relaxing all my muscles. It was then time for my massage which found a new level of relaxation. Don't skimp...go for the 80 minte massage or longer. Also try trhe anti-oxident drink which was rejuvinating. Both Friday and Saturday nights we ate at their first class restaurant called Mesazul. The view of the Blue Monster 18th hole, the sunset plus great food combined to make it a perfect evening. On Sunday morning we teed off at 8:30 on the Blue MOnster which immediatly showed us why it's called a monster. If you are in the rough it has a tendancy to gobble up your ball. Now I know why the pros have such a hard time. If you are a golder, you don't want to miss playing this classic course. It will test all aspects of your game for length, creativity and the par 3's, 2 at over 210 are real challenges. I shot an 84 and was grateful that it wasn't more. The service was excellent. From the arrival, to the pro shop to the spa the employees were welcoming, cheerful, eager to please and friendly. Yes I will be going back because I like being treated the same way I'm treated at my own golf club. Give it a try... you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elirod
Reviews.Content: I own a timeshare at this property, had never used it before. The unit was great, very spacious and clean and had everything we needed (kitchen with everything, washer/dryer, plenty of sleeping room, dining room, dvd, flat screens in every room) The concierge, David Kuczynski accommodated us in a lower floor unit with a sliding door that opened up to the lake, it was great! The facilities were very nice and all the staff was very attentive, specially RamÃ³n who always greeted us in the morning by the BBQ An awesome shuttle service (the guys were great!) that took us to El Doral where you can use their amazing pools, walk around, eat at the restaurants, shop, go to the Spa and play lots of Golf! Great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good experiance but spend the $$ to upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Grahambda
Reviews.Content: Went on a golf package with my wife , got a good deal $220.00 a night included golf and breakfast. It was our anniversary and we travel a lot so asked the question when checking in â€“ "can we upgrade?" (I always find the best upgrade deals are always at the point of check-in) we opted to stay at the Spa Villaâ€™s for an extra $150.00 a night and it was money well spent . Only 48 suites (versus the 500 plus standard rooms) and the parking is adjacent to the Spa/suites. No valet needed or Â½ mile hikes. The Spa suite was large; entrance hall, lounge area with flat screen, king bed, dual patio areas, massive bathroom with two person jet tub, separate â€œhis and hersâ€� toilets with another shower. Full access to the Spa at no extra cost (great for post golf relaxation, steam room, sauna, hot and cold plunge pools, really 1st class. Best of all the Spa suites area is adults only â€“ great pool â€“ no kids! You really can relax. As for the food/restaurants, not so good â€“ just OK but pricey. Breakfast was fine , dinner I would give it a miss and venture out. Everything was within walking distance and they provide a shuttle to one of the courses which is 10 minutes away. Overall a $2k long weekend included golf lesson for me, spa treatment for my wife and the rental car. This is not the Ritz or the Manderin as the rooms are a little tired and the staff are good but not exceptional. Would certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: lozlazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for a week during a timeshare exchange. This place is great for a large group - there were 7 of us and it accommodated us fine. Nice pool and whirpool and staff were friendly. Little shop was ok too. Location was near the airport and bus links for metro-rail ok. However the resort could have done with an on-site restaurant but the Doral across the road was great for restaurants and bars. We also used the pool there too. Shame that it was only over-sized tubs in the room rather than a jacuzzi. Also disappointed that you had to pay for daily housekeeping - we just got our towels changed and threw out the garbage at the trash chute. Would probably return there though if travelling with a large group. Enjoyed Miami and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for large families”
Reviews.Author: Lisatini1013
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to and one night post, for a cruise out of Ft. Lauderdale. We are extended families traveling from Los Angeles with young kids and teenagers. We landed late evening in Miami. This property is close to the airport which worked really well and we didn't need to drive far after a long flight. The front desk staff was extemely friendly and very accommodating, allowing us to check out late the next morning since our cruise didn't start boarding until late afternoon. They also allowed us to check in very early, 10:00 am, upon our return from the cruise. The two bedroom villa worked out perfectly for so many people. It's a great value as it would have been necessary to book 3 seperate rooms had we stayed in a regular type hotel. My only complaint was the housekeeping wasn't up to par with the other Marriott Vacation Clubs I've stayed in. The tile grout in the bathrooms was discolored, especially around the toilets. The extra blankets provided for the sofa beds had hair on them from prior guest, gross! The room had a nice view overlooking the lake and golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Switch”
Reviews.Author: titleist1
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel under a golf package on March 17,2010. My package called for a round of golf per day on either the red course or gold course. The first two rounds on the red and gold courses were fine. The outside golf staff was tremendous. My third round was set on friday at the white course which involves an upgrade. I played by myself and it was a pleasure. I was going to play the gold couse on saturday afternoon and was told by the starter that I had to sign in the pro shop which I had not been asked to go up tp this point. The gentleman in the pro shop informed me that I was not on a package deal and must sign. I signed the slip to give to the starter and went on my way and I told the gentleman that I would check on the snafu when I returned. Upon completion of my round The man in the shop said that he checked and that I was not on any plan and that a charge of 165.00 would be added to my bill. Being the gentleman that i was raised I decided that I would talk to the front desk staff when I checked out the next day. That morning I got my bill slipped under my door and found that the upgrade to the white course was charged at a rate of 240.00 not the 125.00 that I was told. The very nice women at checkout although very polite was unable to solve the problem. I've played golf for over fifty years and have travel to many of the games best destinations including Doral many times. This was the first time I ever had a problem regarding any type of booking error. The rest of the trip was terriffic. The room(648) was as nice as any room I have ever had the pleasure. The new restaurant was a gem. Food was as good as any of the best Miami restaurants and that includes The Forge. The Doral resort has been a favorite of mine for many years and it pained me to have such a negative feeling as I said GOODBYE. Arthur F Buckley. Dartmouth Ma.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at Doral Villas - Ivan Graack”
Reviews.Author: IvanTripGraack
Reviews.Content: First I will say this... We lucked out with the weather. It was mid 80's all week and only rained the Wed before thanksgiving. Stayed in 2 bedroom 2 bath with another family. So 4 adults and 3 kids ages 6,7,8 in the same condo. It was perfect for us. We shopped at beginning of trip to buy breakfast/lunch stuff mostly. Villas are next to the Doral resort but not a quick walk, but there is a shuttle. No other restaurants or food in walking distance however. My and other guy golfed 3 times and I would give the golf staff and course very high marks, as you would expect from a world reknown golf destination. Other hotel staff was hit or miss, pools were nice and the kids enjoyed them. Here's my overall pro's and cons: Pro's: GREAT Golf and golf staff / facilities Well kept up condos and grounds (new tv's installed week were there) Would go back as a golf trip Cons: Resort is only option, Doral is mostly commercial in that area except for the resort (no restaurants, etc, nearby) Non-golf activities were mostly limited to pool.. (spa was under renovation, and did not rate well during construction by my wife, probably better now) Overall.. I want to go back with some guys and play more golf... it's a great golf destination.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential, but needs a little work.”
Reviews.Author: sbeisler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband during a seminar he attended. The rooms needed some work. However, I did notice on our last day that they were painting the hallways and some outside fences, so maybe they are in the middle of renovation. The bathroom needed cleaning, new caulk and the shower doors scrubbed better. The toilet ran and the fan for the air was noisy. Maids who could not speak english or even tell me where the ice machine was yelled up and down the hall at 8:45 am. Otherwise, the grounds were lovely. The Champs restaurant which overlooked the Blue Monster was great and the staff VERY attentive. Strong drinks here. The pool area was very nice, with a waterfall and separate pool area for kids to play with a slide. Staff here was also great, taking orders for the poolside bar. Did not venture to the spa, but from the looks of the other buildings, lobby, etc. it looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Droynick
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with friends in a two bedroom, two bathroom unit on the top floor of one of the units at the Marriott Villas. The location is convenient if you have a car but otherwise it far from most Miami tourist locations. The unit was clean, comfortable and well laid out. The kitchen was reasonably well stocked with dishes, utensils and pots and pans- so much so that we ate all evening meals in the suite. There are 3 TVs with almost a hundred channels and free Wifi. The staff at the Villas and at the associated Doral golf course, which we admired but did not use, were excellent. Whatever we asked for was attended to quickly. We did not use the pool but it looked great for kids with lots of safety fencing to ensure that parents could relax. The associated Doral Golf Resort and Spa, which you can use, is amazing! It has 5 golf courses, and many restaurants, shops and pools. The spa is pricey but looks like the services it provides would be worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingclouds
Reviews.Content: I came here for a 4 day conference. It's a great hotel, but it is a little away from the Miami beach area. The rooms are nice, I would say around average; not what you would expect from typical Marriott Hotels. Walking to the conference rooms is a little difficult when it's raining since there is not a covered walkway directly to the doors of the conference room. The scenery is beautiful and relaxing, as is the pool area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but if you are expecting an extravagant looking room/hotel, then you may be a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could use a facelift.”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastRambler
Reviews.Content: Nice place, but I wonâ€™t say it is up to the expected Marriott vacations standards. When we check the bedding upon arrival and discovered we needed new sheets for the master bed. I called the desk were delivered sheets in about 15 min. They did not offer to change them, just handed them over. Maybe I am being critical, but if I just checked in I expect them to take care of anything that is wrong. The room lay out was great, but they are not capitalizing on the potential when in comes to maintenance. Paint on the lamp posts and trim from when they did the walls, worn carpets, sofas, chairs. Prominent cigarette burns on the carpet, sink counter top, coffee table and night stands. The kitchen was nice, got to love the dishwasher and in room laundry. I would be upset if I had paid more than I did for the 2BR.

Reviews.Title: “What is there to complain about?”
Reviews.Author: Gottagoagain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of October 11, 2009 on a timeshare trade. Everything about the resort was excellent. It was very quiet while we were there - which is what we like. The location was good - easy to get to where we wanted to go. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I took the "Painting on glass" class which I thoroughly enjoyed. The unit had everything you would ever need. Beds were comfortable! Transportation was provided to the Doral Golf Resort. We went over one day, much busier than where we were. If you want to shop, there are malls everywhere. I read an earlier post that spoke of expensive parking. The timeshare Marriott Villas at Doral does not charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and spacious! We'll go back and bring the family.”
Reviews.Author: letsdoteaRenton_Wa
Reviews.Content: Big, beautiful and clean, with all the comforts of home. Helpful and friendly staff. We stayed with my sister and her husband and we all loved the place and want to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amyane
Reviews.Content: Excellent, excellent, and EXCELLENT! It was quiet, the rooms were perfect for 5 of us, the staff were ever so friendly, and the grounds....perfect!!!! I can not wait to go back! The parking was a bit costly though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: kendr390
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villas for girls birthday celebration. The room we had was in unit 6 corner unit which overlooked the lake and the Doral Golf Course. We had full access to the the Golf Course and Spa which was directly across the street from the Villas. The staff was superb. They were able to help us with any thing we needed. Highly recommend and would love to stay at the Villas or the Resort next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are "tired"-- not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: nwb
Reviews.Content: We are longtime Marriott timeshare owners and have traded to stay at more than12 different properties. Doral was the worst we have ever encountered. The furniture is worn, carpet is stained in certain spots, there were no plasma TVs, the walls have been touched up with paint that did not match, and the toilet overflowed. Worst of all the advertised free wireless connection was poor. Most of the time it did not work at all even with the booster that was supplied. Bad situation for me as I am in the middle of online graduate school classes and needed a consistent internet connection. Had to go out and purchase a USB connection device. When we got there we noticed the icemaker in the freezer was not working. We called and were told that it takes a couple hours to get going. Went out and did a week's worth of shopping and put perishables away before going out for a quick bite to eat. Refrigerator seemed warm and ice cream was getting soft. Called again and maintenance man (whom we got to know well) came, discovered the motor was faulty, and within minutes had another full size working refrigerator in our villa. Pretty impressive for a Saturday night. He also stopped by a couple other times to fix the toilet and then to try and fix internet connection(that he couldn't do). When we complained, the GM was very nice and apologized and told us the Villas are up for a refurbishment in the next year or so. He said plasma TVS and accompanying stands are due to be installed this fall/winter.(another reviewer said there were plasmas but the GM said there were not or he would have changed our room.) We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Not their fault that the property needs a renovation. We did not feel that the pool was well maintained -- looked a little dirty to us. The airplanes did not really bother us. If we ever go back, it will be after renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: lilwifey
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the villa were beautiful. Unfortunately, we don't play golf. The villa was all the comforts of home and very spacious. The tub in the master bedroom is HUGE. I really wish there were jets in it. The staff at Doral were really nice and met all our customer service expectations. Because it is a villa don't expect someone to come behind you and clean your room............But one day they did!! that's was a treat...........They will give you all the towels you want!.....They offer activities (fee) that kids and adults alike would enjoy.......If you have GPS try finding areas of interests on your own......you will SAVE money.......we signed up with the hotel staff to go to the Everglades...$45.00 per person. But when we got there the park was only $17.00 per person........We could have driven ourselves!!! that's why you should invest in a GPS........Would definitely go back again

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagofamily04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at villas for 3 nights with kids 10 and 8. Had a great time. Villas are nice but not fancy. Outdated a bit but very practical. Great pool and kids activites. No restaurant at Villas but a quick walk or drive to the main hotel. Grocery store very near by to stock up on snacks and food for room. Very safe, family oriented place. I highly recommend. My kids had a great time and we got to relax. South Beach 20 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay, have tried better Marriott though”
Reviews.Author: Francesca-DM
Reviews.Content: As Marriott timeshare owners, we decided to trade one of our weeks with the one in Miami. Well, I must say that I liked the other Marriott I've been more than this one, although the property has many good qualities. If I had been a golfer, my rating would have been much higher. The Villas are fully integrated with the Doral Golf Resort, a beautiful hotel with world chanpionship golf courses, which is said to be one of the best in the world - no kidding. But unfortunatly, I don't play golf so a golf course for me is nice only for taking a couple of pictures. The worst thing of the resort is location, next to Miami International Airport and right under the American Airlines terminal landing route. So there is one airplane every 2/3 minutes landing off your head and that's not nice!! One more thing I didn't like was that daily housekeeping was not complimentary. That means that you had to pay to have your unit cleaned. That usually never happens at Marriott. But of course your towels were changed on request with no extra charge. The resort had many good qualities though. The units are very beautiful and huge with two marble bedrooms, two bathrooms, three plasma tvs, a huge living room and fully equipped kitchen. The furniture is of excellent quality and refined. The pool is quite big and there is also a small whirpool overlooking the green. There are sunchairs even in the garden, overlooking the beautiful lake and the Doral golf course, bbq areas which can be used by guests, fitness centre, game room and free wireless internet access from rooms and public areas. Free transportation is provided complimentary between the Villas and the Doral, and guests can use the facilities of both. The Doral offers a wide choice of restaurant and a renowed spa. The free use of the Doral pool areas is a great deal. The pools are simply wonderful. There are four outside pools and an inside one, plus a funny waterslide (which I enjoyed, though being 27 years old!...) and many whirpools. You are given as many towels as you wish, free lemonade and other beverages and there are also many free magazines that guests can read. If you don't play golf, I suggest renting a car and visiting around beacuse staying by the pool all day can be boring. The resort is very quiet because most guests spend their time playing golf or visiting/shopping as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Homey but weather was a damper”
Reviews.Author: babyboo999
Reviews.Content: We used our timeshare to trade out for this resort. We felt it was a very good value due to the very large area. It was traditional Marriot but it did sleep 8 people. Two kings and two pull out sofas total. We stayyed all seven days and the weather was a pain in our behind. If I had to do it again, I think I would've stayyed somewehre directly on Miami Beach because we ended up driving down there so much. While you are theyre make sure you wear LOTS and LOTS of bug repellant because we got eaten up! We hung out in the pool ans spa and it was nice, they had fresh towels ready for us. The staff was very helpful, but it would be a hard htoel to stay at if you didn't have na car because the front desk is so far away. We also had a view of the golf course but there were bugs so we never left out room open. We tried out the spa while we were there and it was okay. I don't think it's better than Burke Williams but it was pretty in there. Nice but not as nice as Burke Williams. Some things that you want to make sure that you do are John Pennekamp snorkeling (the best snorkeling I've ever experienced!), shopping in Fort Lauderdale, see the Biltmore, and the Everglade wer fun and worth it. The JW Marriot pool, which we went to the second day, was really nice compared to the Villas one but I thought it was not well maintained, because there was throw up in the jacuzzi and no one ever came to clean it up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: KathyTX
Reviews.Content: The Villas were much nicer than the photos online. The suite was very spacious. We had two bedrooms and two baths. A fully loaded kitchen with all appliances. Great flat top stove. There was even a sofabed in one bedroom and the sofa in the livingroom was a sofabed. The views were spectacular. We could see the 18th hole from our balcony. They provided us with free shuttle service to the Doral which was across the street. We had access to all the amenities at the Doral which was included in the price of the Villa. Parking was just outside our room. The security was great since you had to have a tag on your car rental mirror for parking and used your room key for access to open the gate. Everyone was extremely gracious at the Villas. The Villas had many activities for all ages many of which were free.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Villas at Doral”
Reviews.Author: michelle107
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review whilst still at the Villas at Doral. We came down from Orlando a day early to escape poor weather and I'm so pleased we did. The villas are a good size and immaculately clean. We are a party of 4 (including two strapping 14 year olds) and we have plenty of room. The pool is inviting and the staff have been good when we've needed anything. We've been over to the Doral hotel and that if anything is more up-market. Nice to visit and then come back to our 'villa' though. This morning I had a massage at the spa (deep tissue - and effective) and my husband played the 'white' golf course (tougher than he expected!). Glad we're here three nights rather than two.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: We wanted to visite Miami and ended up in the Marriott's Villas at Doral. When you think Miami... you think Miami Beach. Well, it's not near this place. The Villas at Doral are across the street from the Marriott Doral hotel. It can be a busy street. But there is a complimentary shuttle bus from the Villas to the hotel. And because the pools are so much nicer at the hotel, you might want to go there. We have seen the concept before of Marriott Villas near a Marriott hotel, but not with a busy street inbetween. That was a bummer. The Villas at Doral have not that much to offer. The pool is small and to often the shade of the buildings take away the sun from the pool. For Miami Beach you are in the wrong place. This is more a inland resort. The rooms are nice, as usual with Marriott. For shopping it is located okay if you have a car. There are a few shopping malls not that far away (but neither that close!). The pools from the neighbouring hotel are worthwhile. We had a bad experience in the jacuzzi. They composition of the water ruined our bathing suits. We commented on this and the only respons we got was that they were going to notify the pool people. Whow! That helped my bathing suit a lot! All in all: we would not return: there are better options to go!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Villas @ Doral Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: Diamondgirl
Reviews.Content: Seeing that I have stayed at several Marriott properties that were completely outstanding, makes me say that this resort is just o.k. I am so used to Marriott properties being really huge with several pools and beautiful landscaping. The rooms themselves were decent. Our room (Building 6000) was updated and everything seemed pretty new. My only problem with being on the top floor corner unit (something I always request) is at this resort, the balcony on the top floor has no covering. So when it rains (and it did quite often), you cannot sit out on the balcony. The carpeting next to the balcony entrance would always get soaked. I never could understand that concept of not having the top balcony covered. Other than that, the resort is beautiful. Pool was small compared to other Marriott Resorts, but nice. The staff was friendly and accomodating. They have scheduled activities and tours daily. Never ate at the resort, we alway ate out so I am not sure about the food. Again, overall the stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: willian3
Reviews.Content: Our stay in May was really nice. I had a rental car and found the place easily. I was coming from FLL airport. The two bedrooms are a really nice size with a full kitchen and indoor and out door eating area. I am going to take a leap here but I believe all the rooms have a glorious view of the lake and golf course. The rooms were clean and everything worked fine. There was a huge soaking tub and a large standing shower in the master. And one more combination shower/bath for the other room. The washer and dryer in the room also came in handy. It has a small but nice gym with a little game room on the side, played a little pool on the boring day. Staff was really nice and had printed directions to everyplace that I wanted to go. I would defiantly say you need a car to get around. Not to say everything is far, more like around the corner and up the road a mile and a half. The are many restaurants in the area and fast food and supermarket in the area. It's a great place for families but I would stay here also if I was trying to get away from my family, LOL... I would defiantly keep this place in mind when I come back to Florida. Oh this was a family trip of 5 adults and 1 toddler. We utilized both beds in the rooms plus the pull out in the living room. There were no complaints from the couple sleeping on the pull out. I think there was one other pull out in the other bed room also. The two bedroom suite could hold 7 comfortable, 8 might be a squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Unclean, Ridiculous Costs.”
Reviews.Author: KYEllerman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doral for 4 nights and were extremely disappointed in almost all aspects of our stay. On a positive note, the staff was friendly. However, our room was really dirty! The drink prices- alcohol and non-alcohol- were outrageous, even for a resort. With tip, well over $15 for a basic mixed drink and about $3.50 for just a can of soft drink. The food was mediocre, at best, with high prices consistent with those of the beverages. The pool was lovely, but getting pool towels was difficult- they were old, small, rationed and you had to pay $5.00 per towl if they were "lost". To use a pool flotation noodle, you had to rent it for $6.00 per day! If you want solely a golf experience, this might be your place. But, for anything beyond just playing golf, I recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Spa Suites are Amazing”
Reviews.Author: peggyplee
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to stay at the Marriott Spa Suites after a conference in South Florida. I was incredible. Great Spa and Salon. Great Food. Great Service.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal end to our cruise vacation”
Reviews.Author: kanfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on the final night of our cruise vacation. We arrived at 9:00 a.m. after getting off the ship hoping to at least be able to stow our luggage and hang out at the pool while awaiting to check in. We were shocked to find out a room was ready for us! We proceeded to our villa and were totally amazed at the size, layout, and view from our villa. We were in building 5 on the 5th floor overlooking the White course. I get goosebumps thinking about it. While the family napped, I got the laundry started in our in room washer and dryer and proceeded to the front desk to inquire about a golf cart to go see the courses. The front desk manager, Andrew, volunteered to take me on a tour. We went on a 30 minute tour of the White course and over to the Blue Monster course. I was in golf lovers heaven! Later, we got another golf cart ride over to the "Blue Lagoon" spa pool area at the Doral for an afternoon in the pool. My children were amazed and had the time of their lives. The bartender, Jose, at the Bungalous poolside bar makes amazing margaritas! He was so nice too, comping some ice cream to our children when they had to wait a few minutes while he tended to his bar customers. Overall, we have never experienced such a phenomenal property. Our only suggestion, stop at a market and pick up some groceries if you do not have access to a car. You have a full kitchen and dining room to host meals in your villa. The dining establishments at the Doral are very expensive, and expect to drop $60.00 plus for lunch for a family of 4. Dinner would easily be twice that. We are hoping to take some extended family for a 2-3 night stay for some golf in the future. Check Expedia for amazing rates. We stayed for $179.00, but the villas can be as much as $500.00. Book early and get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “The beds are great BUT BORING”
Reviews.Author: jos3girls
Reviews.Content: We loved the beds! They were so comfortable! We had to go across the street to the main hotel for any real kids activities and to get anything to eat. They have a marketplace express and barely even had a soda available! The hotel is beautiful and so relaxing, the timeshare is very quiet with not much going on. VERY disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Marriott's Villas at Doral”
Reviews.Author: bjbruno
Reviews.Content: We had a one week stay at Marriott's Villas at Doral (April 2008) and couldn't have been more pleased. This is a smaller Marriott resort (only 98 villas), and all villas are 2 bedroom, 2 bath. Two of the buildings over look the pool (and were refurbished during the summer of 2007), the rest of the buildings over look the lake. This resort is maintained very nicely, and the staff couldn't have been more pleasant. The resort has activities designed for children as well as adults (we took a walking tour of the Doral Resort & Spa) across the street from the villas (3 golf courses, beautiful spa, pools & restaurants); that villa guests are welcome to use. The villas fitness center (on the second floor) is very nice (a portion of it over looks the pool and lake), and most of the equipment is new within the past few months. There is also a game room next to the fitness center. This resort is very close to the Miami airport (15 minutes) as well as major freeways. Plenty of retail and restaurants within a 5 minute drive, and lots of sights and things to do. We had no problem finding our way to a baseball game at Dolphins Stadium, South Beach, Sharks Valley State Park, and Singer Island (1 1/2 hour drive). I would highly recommend this resort, and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed”
Reviews.Author: love2dance81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. We stayed a few nights after we took a cruise out of miami. It was really relaxing. I loved the bed, it was just so comfortable. The first night we didn't do much we just ordered room service. The highlight was that they had Ben and Jerry Pints. Very yummy. The next day we took a cab over to the Dolphin Mall. That place is so huge, We saw a movie, went to lunch and shopped until we dropped. One of the things I noticed about this hotel was that everytime you passed a member of the hotel's staff they always said hi to us. That doesn't always happen when you stay places. If you have the money you should book a room.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about!!”
Reviews.Author: Shakita
Reviews.Content: I go to the Doral area quite often to do my shopping and I have been around several hotels. This is by far the worst experience of all. My husband is a Marriot's fanatic so when we travel with him we need to stay at a Marriot. The location is excellent, finding it if you are not familiar with the area or at night will prove an odissey. The check in counter is pretty much non-existant and it would be helpful to be explained of how this hotel works at check-in. I was with my husband and my 4 year old. Lots of walking, very little parking and the rooms are in very poor condition. Doesnt feel like a Marriot at all, more like a motel. Don't expect the full clean up of a hotel, you will get clean towels and a very rude maid will come once a day at a fixed time and if you are not out of the room, Too bad!!! All in all i dont recommend it, stay in there only if you dont have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Perfect for the Disabled Consumer.”
Reviews.Author: scbleo
Reviews.Content: Use caution when checking into this establishment or you will end up like we did, on the first floor in a special needs rooms with a black spider greeting you in the morning. The personnel at the front desk were quick to get me on my way and failed to advise me that they had given us a special needs room. When I called to request a change, I was told that all the rooms were like this. Needless to say, the closets are all split in two, so if you have a gown or long dress, do not plan on hanging it in any of the closets in this villa. The master bath shower has a steel medical seat in the walk in shower. All the fixtures and furniture, including tables and chairs are low and appropriately porportioned for wheel chair access. Not comfortable for anyone over five feet two. The hotel site also fails to mention that there are truly only 2 beds, a king in the master and a queen in the 2nd bedroom. The 2nd bedroom also has a sofa bed in it that if it was opened for usage would block the access to the bedroom's door and closet. Not practical at all. The 2nd bath is actually roomy and comfortable. There is a 2nd sofabed with a flimsy mattress in the living room. Because we were in 5101, 1st floor, the living room leads to an exterior patio that is not secured from the outside area in any way, so anyone can sit and walk through the exterior area. Security is meek in an area that is heavily populated and with a metro airport, miami international, as a neighbor to offer the background noise. The 3 barbeques and pool area were literally within 25 feet of the patio off our living room. So if it had been a longer stay, I am sure we would have had to endure others cooking and socializing right by our livingroom doors at all hours of the night. At 8:15 am, we were awoken by the foul language of property employees who were turning on the water hose, that appeared to be directly under our bedroom windows. Once the faucets was turned on, the water sound was enough to wake up the dead. So between the language of the staff and the water turmoil from our bedroom window, we were rudely awoken and upset. Not exactly a good experience. The room in itself was nice and roomy, with the exception of it being designed for someone with disabilities. If ALL the villa suites are like this, then perhaps the units need to be identified appropriately before we rent them. The parking was plentiful, and the location was convenient. The staff is inept and uncaring. With all the options in the area, look for something else, especially if traveling for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, pleasant, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Carolinne
Reviews.Content: My family and I (group of 7 adults) took two 2-bedroom villas. Helpful check in people managed to put us next door to each other (although the hotel was almost fully booked). Apartments are beautifully furnished, spacious, fully equipped kitchen and the suite has a very large bathroom with a huge bath. Location is great, next to the airport and freeways. Beautiful complex, large swimming pool. Breakfast across the street at the Doral (included on the package) is wonderful. Package also included one round of golf (no hassle booking the previous night for an early morning game). Since we were travelling to the Caribbean and would only be back a week later, they were more than nice to store our luggage (all 14 large pieces of it!). In short, I would highly recommend for families travelling to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: wmn9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over the July 4th holiday. We own a timeshare in the Marriott system so we stayed cheap. When I booked, I could have paid the same price at the Doral across the street with kids eat free. We made the right choice for the extra room, and after seeing how bad the Doral Hotel's room are. The pool at the Villas is nice, and we went across the Doral's Pool twice because the kids liked the big slide there. The room was completely renovated and is just a little smaller than other Marriott Timeshares. Would suggest to anyone who has a family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Complex - But Spread Out”
Reviews.Author: fsu8503
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Marriott Complex down in Doral where the famous "Blue Monster" Golf Course is. The area is beautiful. Parking was a major hassle. If you valet it is done at the main lodge which is a couple of minutes from the outermost buildings. If you self-park it is a few more minutes of a walk, which is the Florida heat isn't too great. When you check in, take advantage of a bellman to take you to your room. My colleague and I attempted to find our building and it took 15 minutes in the dark because it was not easily accessible or clearly marked. The rooms were great and most opened out into a courtyard. Good beds and it was quite clean. Strangely you had to turn the AC down very low to get a workable temperature - not sure why. However, mine sat on 60 for most of the week. Area is beautiful and well landscaped. The hotel was easy to find and only about 10-12 minutes from the MIA. Just down the road is a McDonalds and Burger King for breakfast. And a little farther west is a Starbucks. The main building of the hotel has a coffee shop, but not as good as Starbucks. The exercise room is fairly big and nice. It is kind of hidden but once you go there once it is easy to find. I'd love to return to the hotel and golf, but I have a feeling the regular rate would be quite costly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Brimin2
Reviews.Content: Excellent little getaway. Great pool, beautiful villas with full kitchen. The master bedroom is amazing!! Game room & weight room were great. Kids had a blast!! Stayed here with a group of children for a slumber party & everyone was amazed by the place. Had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious accomodations”
Reviews.Author: bubbleslt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott vacation property with a friend on a long weekend trip down to Miami to visit the Chihuly exhibit at the Fairchild Botanical Gardens. We wanted 2 beds, ideally a suite, because one of us stays up late and one gets up early. The 2-bedroom villa was perfect for our needs. The villa is big enough for a family. It was clean, new-looking, comfortable. The soaking tub was huge - not jetted, and the bathroom in the larger bedroom is open to the room (the shower and toilet are in a separate space with a door.) As a villa, on-site dining isn't available, but there is a shuttle to the Marriott Doral Resort across the street; we didn't go there. Check-in was smooth, friendly. We stayed only one night, and didn't go to the pool or any other facilities. Standing by the front door, you could hear the traffic on the street, but it wasn't noticable in the front bedroom. We never heard a neighbor. Would recommend this property for families or friends traveling together - it's a lot of space for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Pierry
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Villas. There is something for everyone. Great pool, game rooms, malls, supermarkets and all the exciting things to do in Miami Beach. We went to the Sony Ericsson tennis open and all of us had fun. The resort is excellent. It is a good place to spend family time and spring break. The staff is friendly and helpful. They even sent me the camera I mistakenly left behind.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Villas at Doral
HotelInfo.Address: 4101 NW 87th Ave, Miami, FL 33178
